reason: Species is rat; in vivo single-unit electrophysiology and LFP recordings are present.

header.title: Spike-based coupling between single neurons and populations across rat sensory cortices, perirhinal cortex, and hippocampus
header.authors: Reinder Dorman, Jeroen J. Bos, Martin A. Vinck, Pietro Marchesi, Julien Fiorilli, Jeanette A.M. Lorteije, Ingrid Reiten, Jan G. Bjaalie, Michael Okun, Cyriel M.A. Pennartz

data_description.recording_type: In vivo tetrode recordings (single-unit and LFP)
data_description.brain_region: Hippocampal CA1, somatosensory cortex (S1BF), visual cortex (V1), perirhinal cortex (PER)
data_description.behavioral_task: Two-choice visual discrimination task on a figure-8 maze

spike_level.unit_inclusion_thresholds: Clusters accepted when inter-spike interval of 2 ms was contaminated with < 0.1% of total spike count; minimum of 3 cells per session and area for inclusion
spike_level.temporal_binning_filters: Spiking activity extracted from bandpass filtered (600–6,000 Hz) signals, digitized at 3 kHz; 1 ms epochs
spike_level.computed_metrics: Single-neuron population coupling (SNPC), Z-scored to shuffled distribution; firing rate; waveform shape; spatial selectivity
spike_level.stat_controls: Kruskal–Wallis test, Wilcoxon’s signed-rank and rank sum tests, Bonferroni correction, bootstrapping (1,000 iterations), Freedman-Diaconis’ method for binning

spatial_level.frm_bin_size_coord: Maze segmented into 51 equally sized spatial bins (~9 cm each)
spatial_level.spatial_metrics: Spatial selectivity of CA1 cells; negative correlation between SNPC and spatial selectivity
spatial_level.object_cue_related: Visual and tactile cues (CS+ and CS− symbols, sandpaper texture) used in behavioral task

population_level.correlation_measures: Spearman’s rank correlation, Pearson’s correlation, cross-correlation of single-unit with population activity
population_level.dimensionality_reduction: Not specified (multi-Gaussian curve fitting and dimensionality reduction mentioned but not systematically used)
population_level.clustering: Automated and manual spike sorting based on waveform features
population_level.decoding_prediction: Decoding of reference cell’s spiking activity from population rates; explained variance
population_level.synchrony_assembly: Broadcasting Index (number of areas a single cell is significantly coupled with); analysis of synchrony across areas

temporal_network.cross_correlation: Cross-correlation of single-unit activity with summed population activity within and between areas
temporal_network.network_metrics: Broadcasting Index (BI); analysis of within- and between-area coupling; meta-network characterization
temporal_network.spike_lfp_coherence: Not specified (LFPs mentioned as context for CA1 synchrony, but no explicit spike-LFP coherence analysis described)
